snippet: A panel of advisers urged President Obama to change the way the National Security Agency collects the telephone data of Americans, spies on foreign leaders and prepares for cyberattacks abroad.
abstract: Panel of outside advisers urges Pres Obama to impose major oversight and some restrictions on National Security Agency; argues that enhancement of agency's powers over past dozen years have been at the expense of personal privacy; recommends changes in how NSA collects telephone data of Americans, spies on foreign leaders and prepares for cyberattacks abroad.

byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and CHARLIE SAVAGE

lead_paragraph: A panel of advisers urged President Obama to change the way the National Security Agency collects the telephone data of Americans, spies on foreign leaders and prepares for cyberattacks abroad.

headline.main: Obama Is Urged to Sharply Curb N.S.A. Data Mining
